channel.title: Home on Spatial Group
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Spatial Group

item.title: PhD Opportunities in our Lab
item.description: PhD Opportunities in the Group Our group is constantly evolving. A large cohort of students will be finishing their research soon, and we are therefore looking for new ideas, new projects, and creative young minds to join us!

item.title: Reza Arabsheibani
item.description: Bio Reza Arabsheibani joined our group in December 2021. He is a Ph.

item.title: Kamal's review of spatial causal inference published
item.description: We are very proud of Kamal’s achievement, publishing his first first-authored paper in Geographical Analysis!

item.title: Martin promoted to Associate Professor
item.description: Effective from January 2022, Martin has been promoted to Associate Professor.

item.title: Biogeoref2021 Hackaton win for our team!
item.description: It is with immense pride that we share that our team consisting of Ehsan Hamzei, Kimia Amoozandeh and Kamal Akbari have won the BioGeoRef2021 Hackaton, organised as part of the Spatial Data Science 2021 Symposium.

item.title: Projects
item.description: This is a brief list and summary of the projects undertaken in our group.

item.title: Brian Armstrong
item.description: Bio I’ve got my PhD degree from Latrobe University in 2020.

item.title: Ehsan Hamzei
item.description: Bio I’ve got my PhD degree from the University of Melbourne in 2021, supervised by Prof Stephan Winter and co-supervised by Martin Tomko.

item.title: Re-launch of the site
item.description: After a long hiatus, this Website is coming back to life.

item.title: Seeking a Research Fellow in Indigenous Engineering Mapping!
item.description: We are growing! Join us for a fascinating research journey into the history of Indigenous Engineering in Australia.

item.title: Kiersten
item.description: Bio Kiersten Jowett joined our group in 2020. She is researching the concept of Proof-of-Location in Distributed Ledgers (think Blockchain).

item.title: Xiaonan
item.description: Bio Xiaonan Wang joined our group in 2019. She is conducting research on the complex reasoning that emerges from the incompatible hierarchical conceptualisations of places.

item.title: Hang
item.description: Bio Hang Zhao joined our group in 2018, and he is investigating Real-Time Range Sensor (LIDAR) Navigation Using a 3D Model.

item.title: Subhrasankha Dey
item.description: Bio Subhra joined our group in 2018, and he explores the means to estimate urban traffic flows from small subsets of the overall traffic – based on trajectory data typically collected by Satellite Navigation companies.

item.title: Zexian
item.description: Bio Zexian Huang joined our group in 2021, after undertaking his Masters project with Prof Kourosh Khoshelham and Martin.

item.title: Youjin
item.description: Bio Youjin Choe joined our group in 2019. Youjin comes with a wealth of experience working with intergovernmental organisations deploying GIS solutions across South-East Asia.

item.title: Kamal Akbari
item.description: Bio Kamal joined our group in 2019, and is researching causal inference methods adapted to spatial data and spatial processes.

item.title: Rajesh Chittor Sundaram
item.description: Bio Rajesh joined our group in 2017. As part of the Self-Healing Maps project, he is investigating issues in missing data in spatial datasets (in particular, OpenStreetMap).

item.title: Kimia Amouzandeh
item.description: Bio Kimia joined our group in 2019, and she is working on indoor wayfinding and localization by verbal descriptions.

item.title: Martin Tomko
item.description: Bio I am a Spatial Information Scientist and geographic information systems expert.

item.title: Ivan Majic -- Alumni
item.description: Bio Ivan Majic joined our group at 2017, and completed his PhD in 2021, working on ternary qualitative spatial relationships as part of the Self-Healing Maps project.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Dr. Martin Tomko Associate Professor Department of Infrastructure Engineering Melbourne Connect – Office 6313 Faculty of Engineering and Information Technology

item.title: About the Spatial Group
item.description: We are a Spatial Information Science/Spatial Data Science research group at the University of Melbourne, led by Dr.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Note: This page contains a reasonably updated list of publications by all members of the group (often, but not necessarily co-authored by Martin Tomko).

item.title: Question Answering Demo
item.description: Choose an example... What is the name of closest pub to Trafalgar Square?

item.title: Come and help us breathe life into the future of Mapping!
item.description: We have acquired an exciting new piece of equipment – a Clearpath Robotics Husky Autonomous Ground Vehicle, fully kitted with a variety of sensors, including automotive-standard Velodyne LIDAR.
